quote: We demonstrate through extensive experiments the ability of the proposed model to learn efﬁcient representations for both binary and multi-class segmentation tasks on a variety of medical images from different modalities.
we demonstrate that Sharp U-Net yields signiﬁcantly improved performance over the vanilla U-Net model for both binary and multi-class segmentation of medical images.
we propose Sharp U-Net, a novel end-to-end depthwise convolutional network architecture for biomedical image segmentation.

the encoder features undergo a depthwise convolution (i.e. spatial convolution operation performed independently over each channel of the encoder features) by using a sharpening spatial kernel, with the aim to reduce feature mismatch.
We demonstrate and analyze the performance of the proposed image segmentation model on four datasets
the proposed Sharp U-Net for multi-class segmentation is trained in an end-to-end fashion.
U-Net is a fully convolutional network for binary and multi-class biomedical image segmentation.
Sharp U-Net is robust to image irregularities.
Therefore, we believe that our proposed architecture can serve as a viable segmentation tool for binary and multi-class segmentation of medical images.
